result.execSummary:
The defendant Nickolas R Raether was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Deg. Sex Assault-Intoxicated Victim, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(cm).
  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 398 days credit.  Chippewa County Case No. 14CF191 and uncharged DA Case No. 14-3596 are dismissed and read-in.

superMiscConds.notes:
To be determined for any medical or counseling required for victims.
Pursuant to an Order (DOC-31) dated July 8, 2015, Restitution is to be detemined for any medical or counseling required for the victims of these matters.  *includes 14CF191 (d & ri) and uncharged police report 14-3596*

Plus supervision fees.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  $250 represents the DNA Surcharge.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

No contact with:  any female under the age of 18 without prior written permission from Probation Agent.  No cell phone or any other electronic device that can take pictures without written prior permission from Probation Agent.  Not to possess computer, software or hardware, modem or any device that is internet compatible without prior written permission from Probation Agent.  No contact with any victims in all cases including read-in and uncharged.  Not to work or volunteer for work with children under the age of 16.  Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.    Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Submit a DNA sample.  Comply with mandatory sex offender registration and any mandatory GPS or residence restrictions.
